comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Possibly John N Carlisle, New York State Commissioner of Highways. See, e.g., www.jstor.org/pss/1193387

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: John Nelson Carlisle (1866-1931) — also known as John N. Carlisle — of Watertown, Jefferson County, N.Y. Born in Preble, Cortland County, N.Y., August 24, 1866. Great-grandson of William Carlisle; grandson of Nelson Burdick; son of Catherine Rose (Burdick) Carlisle and William S. Carlisle; married, January 17, 1894, to Carrie C. Brown. Democrat. Lawyer; chair of Jefferson County Democratic Party, 1891-96; secretary of New York Democratic Party, 1898-1905; delegate to Democratic National Convention from New York, 1904. Universalist. Member, Freemasons; Knights Templar. Died July 21, 1931. Burial location unknown. Source: politicalgraveyard.com/bio/carfield-carll.html
